Sampling

Contents

  • Schema
  • Examples
    • Constant (implicit)

Sampling#

Most fields in complex schemas, like scenarios, specify samplers of values. Simplified notations are used for elementary samplers, like constant values

field: 1.0

of sequences of values

field: [1.0, 2.0, 3.0]

while other samplers need to be specified explictly, like

field:
  sampler: uniform
  from: 1.0
  to: 2.0

All samplers share a common parameter navground::sim::Sampler::once that freezes the sampler once the first sample has been drawn. Set it to apply the same value to all agents in a group. For example, in a scenario specified by

groups:
  - number: 10
    radius: [1.0, 2.0, 3.0]
    once: true

all ten agents will be assigned radius=1.0 in the first run, radius=2.0 in the second, and so on. If instead the scenario is specified by

groups:
  - number: 10
    radius: [1.0, 2.0, 3.0]
    once: false

in any run, the first agent will get radius=1.0, the second radius=2.0, and so on.

Schema#

$schema: "https://json-schema.org/draft/2020-12/schema"
$id: /schemas/sampler<T>
title: Sampler<T>
anyOf:
  - $ref: #/$defs/constant<T>
  - $ref: #/$defs/sequence<T>
  - $ref: #/$defs/regular<T>
  - $ref: #/$defs/regular_step<T>
  - $ref: #/$defs/uniform<T>
  - $ref: #/$defs/normal<T>
$defs:
  constant<T>:
    oneOf:
       - type: T
       - type: object
         properties:
           sampler:
             const: constant
           value: T
           once: bool
         required: [sampler, value]
  sequence<T>:
    oneOf:
       - type: array
         items: T
       - type: object
         properties:
           sampler:
             const: sequence
           values:
             type: array
             items: T
           once: bool
         wrap:
           enum: [loop, repeat, terminate]
         required: [sampler, values]
  choice<T>:
    type: object
    properties:
      sampler:
        const: choice
      values:
        type: array
        items: T
      once: bool
    required: [sampler, values]
  # limited to T=number, vector2
  $ requires step or [to, number]
  regular<T>:
    type: object
    properties:
      sampler:
        const: regular
      from: T
      step: T
      to: T
      number: integer
      wrap:
        enum: [loop, repeat, terminate]
      once: bool
    required: [sampler, from]
  grid:
    type: object
    properties:
      sampler:
        const: regular
      from: T
      to: T
      numbers:
        type: array,
        items: integer,
        minItems: 2,
        maxItems: 2
      wrap:
        enum: [loop, repeat, terminate]
      once: bool
    required: [sampler, from, to, numbers]
  uniform:
    type: object
    properties:
      sampler:
        const: uniform
      from: number
      to: number
      once: bool
    required: [sampler, from, to]
  normal<T>:
    type: object
    properties:
      sampler:
        const: normal
      min: number
      max: number
      mean: number
      std_dev: number
      once: bool
    required: [sampler, mean, std_dev]

Examples#

Constant (implicit)#

1.0

Constant (explicit)#

sampler: constant
value: 0.5

Sequence (implicit)#

[1.0, 2.0, 2.0, 1.0]

Sequence (explicit)#

sampler: sequence
values: [1.0, 2.0, 2.0, 1.0]

Choice#

sampler: choice
values: [1.0, 2.0, 2.0, 1.0]

Regular#

sampler: regular
from: 0.1
to: 0.5
number: 4

Regular (step)#

sampler: regular
from: 0.1
step: 0.1

Grid#

sampler: regular
from: [0, 0]
to: [1, 1]
number: [2, 2]

Random uniform#

sampler: uniform
from: 0.1
to: 0.2

Random normal#

sampler: normal
mean: 0.2
std_dev: 0.1
min: 0.0
max: 1.0

previous

next
